Description: Defines a comment
Specifies the document type
Defines a hyperlink
Defines an abbreviation or acronym
Defines an acronym
Deprecated: Yes (HTML5). Use <abbr> instead. Deprecated to improve semantic markup.

Description: Defines contact information for the author/owner of a document
Embeds a Java applet
Deprecated: Yes (HTML4.01, removed in HTML5). Use <object> instead. Deprecated due to security concerns and obsolescence of Java applets.

Description: Defines an area inside an image map
Defines an independent, self-contained content
Defines content aside from the page content
Embeds sound content in documents
Example Usage: <audio controls><source src="audio.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">Your browser does not support the audio element.</audio>

Description: Specifies bold text
Specifies the base URL/target for all relative URLs in a document
Specifies a default color, size, and font for all text in a document
Deprecated: Yes (HTML4, removed in HTML5). Use CSS instead. Deprecated to separate structure from presentation.

Description: Isolates a part of text that might be formatted in a different direction from other text outside it
Example Usage: This text is in English, but the next word is عربي which is Arabic.

Description: Overrides the current text direction
Defines bigger text
Deprecated: Yes (HTML5). Use CSS font-size instead. Deprecated to separate structure from presentation.

Description: Defines a section that is quoted from another source
Defines the document's body
Example Usage:
This is a heading

This is a paragraph.

Description: Defines a single line break
Example Usage:
This is a paragraph
with a line break.

Description: Defines a clickable button
Used to draw graphics, on the fly, via scripting (usually JavaScript)
Defines a table caption
Defines centered text
Deprecated: Yes (HTML4, removed in HTML5). Use CSS text-align: center instead. Deprecated to separate structure from presentation.

Description: Defines the title of a work
Example Usage: The Scream by Edvard Munch. Painted in 1893.

Description: Defines a piece of computer code
Specifies column properties for each column within a <colgroup> element
Specifies a group of one or more columns in a table for formatting
Links the given content with a machine-readable translation
Specifies a list of pre-defined options for input controls
Defines a description/value of a term in a description list
Defines text that has been deleted from a document
Defines additional details that the user can view or hide
Specifies a term that is going to be defined within the content
Example Usage: HTML is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

Description: Defines a dialog box or window
Defines a directory list
Deprecated: Yes (HTML5). Use <ul> instead. Deprecated due to lack of semantic meaning.

Description: Defines a section in a document
Example Usage:
This is a heading in a div element

This is some text in a div element.

Description: Defines a description list
Defines a term/name in a description list
Defines emphasized text
Defines a container for an external application or interactive content
Groups related elements in a form
Defines a caption for a <figure> element
Specifies self-contained content
Defines font, color, and size for text
Deprecated: Yes (HTML4, removed in HTML5). Use CSS instead. Deprecated to separate structure from presentation.
Example Usage: <font color="red" size="3" face="Verdana">This is some text!</font>

Description: Defines a footer for a document or section
Defines an HTML form for user input
Defines a window (a frame) in a frameset
Deprecated: Yes (HTML5). Use <iframe> or CSS instead. Deprecated due to usability and accessibility concerns.

Description: Defines a set of frames
Deprecated: Yes (HTML5). Use CSS to create layouts instead. Deprecated due to usability and accessibility concerns.

Description: Defines HTML headings
Example Usage:
This is heading 1

This is heading 2

This is heading 3

Description: Contains metadata/information for the document
Defines a header for a document or section
Example Usage:
Welcome to My Website

A site about web development

Description: Groups heading elements
Deprecated: Yes (HTML5), but reintroduced in HTML 5.2. Use individual heading elements instead when deprecated. Deprecated due to lack of widespread use and potential confusion.

Description: Defines a thematic change in the content
Example Usage:
This is some text

This is some other text

Description: Defines the root of an HTML document
Defines a part of text in an alternate voice or mood
Defines an inline frame
Defines an image
Defines an input control
Defines a text that has been inserted into a document
Defines keyboard input
Defines a label for an <input> element
Defines a caption for a <fieldset> element
Defines a list item
Defines the relationship between a document and an external resource
Specifies the main content of a document
Example Usage:
Most Important Content

This is the main content of the webpage.

Description: Defines an image map
Defines marked/highlighted text
Defines a list/menu of commands
Defines metadata about an HTML document
Defines a scalar measurement within a known range
Attributes: value, min, max, low, high, optimum

Description: Defines navigation links
Defines an alternate content for users that do not support frames
Deprecated: Yes (HTML5). Use CSS for layout instead. Deprecated along with frames due to accessibility and usability concerns.

Description: Defines an alternate content for users that do not support client-side scripts
Defines an embedded object
Defines an ordered list
Defines a group of related options in a drop-down list
Defines an option in a drop-down list
Defines the result of a calculation
Example Usage: <form oninput="x.value=parseInt(a.value)+parseInt(b.value)"><input type="range" id="a" value="50">+<input type="number" id="b" value="25">=<output name="x" for="a b"></output></form>

Description: Defines a paragraph
Defines a parameter for an object
Defines a container for multiple image resources
Defines preformatted text
Example Usage: Text in a pre element is displayed in a fixed-width font, and preserves both spaces and line breaks

Description: Represents the progress of a task
Defines a short quotation
Example Usage: WWF's goal is to: Build a future where people live in harmony with nature.

Description: Defines what to show in browsers that do not support ruby annotations
Defines an explanation/pronunciation of characters (for East Asian typography)
Defines a ruby annotation (for East Asian typography)
Defines text that is no longer correct
Example Usage: My car is blue. My new car is silver.

Description: Defines sample output from a computer program
Example Usage:
Message from my computer:

File not found.
Press F1 to continue

Description: Defines a client-side script
Defines a search section
Defines a section in a document
Example Usage:
WWF

The World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) is an international organization working on issues regarding the conservation, research and restoration of the environment.

Description: Defines a drop-down list
Defines smaller text
Example Usage: This is some normal text. This is some smaller text.

Description: Defines multiple media resources for media elements (<video> and <audio>)
Example Usage: <video width="320" height="240" controls><source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4"><source src="movie.ogg" type="video/ogg"></video>

Description: Defines a section in a document
Defines strikethrough text
Deprecated: Yes (HTML5). Use <s> or <del> instead. Deprecated to improve semantic markup.

Description: Defines important text
Defines style information for a document
Defines subscripted text
Example Usage: H2O is the chemical formula for water.

Description: Defines a visible heading for a <details> element
Defines superscripted text
Example Usage: The 4th of July is American Independence Day.

Description: Defines a container for SVG graphics
Example Usage: <svg width="100" height="100"><circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" /></svg>

Description: Defines a table
Groups the body content in a table
Defines a cell in a table
Defines a template
Defines a multiline input control (text area)
Example Usage: <textarea name="message" rows="10" cols="30">The cat was playing in the garden.</textarea>

Description: Groups the footer content in a table
Defines a header cell in a table
Groups the header content in a table
Defines a date/time
Defines a title for the document
Defines a row in a table
Defines text tracks for media elements (<video> and <audio>)
Example Usage: <video width="320" height="240" controls><source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4"><track src="subtitles_en.vtt" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" label="English"></video>

Description: Defines teletype text
Deprecated: Yes (HTML5). Use CSS instead. Deprecated to separate structure from presentation.

Description: Defines text that should be stylistically different from normal text
Defines an unordered list
Defines a variable
Example Usage: The area of a triangle is: 1/2 x b x h, where b is the base, and h is the vertical height.

Description: Defines a video or movie
Example Usage: <video width="320" height="240" controls><source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4"><source src="movie.ogg" type="video/ogg"></video>

Description: Defines a possible line-break
